svcproc.title: 60AAC - International® Diamond Logic® PowerPack 3
svcproc.para: 60AAC - BODY INTG, POWER INVERTER - 3000 Watt dynamic (with engine running), on/off switch in instrument panel and includes 120 volt AC wiring connection for customer mounted power outlet.
This feature provides heavy duty mobile AC power (up to 3000 Watts with a 5000 Watt surge capability) for power tools, lights, pumps and compressors.

note.para: The surge capability may not be sufficient to start all makes/models of compressors.

svcproc.para: The pure sine wave output also provides the necessary requirements for sensitive equipment such as computers and test equipment.
SOFTWARE FEATURE CODES / PROGRAMMABLE PARAMETERS: NONE
This feature is factory installed along with special alternator, 08GGC. The wiring that must be done to complete this feature involves location and of the 120 VAC GFCI, circuit breaker and ground.

warning.para: All electrical wiring and connections should be performed by a licensed, qualified electrician.

DO NOT OPEN the PowerPack 3. Potentially fatal electric shock and/or serious damage may result even after the PowerPack 3 is removed from the vehicle. Only a Qualified Technician may perform service inside the PowerPack 3. Failure to comply could result in injury including death and will void the warranty.

item.para: Output Voltage: The AC output voltage of the PowerPack 3 is 120 VAC, 25 Amps, 60 Hz, single phase, 3 wire.

AC wire size selection: To properly size the AC output wiring, use wire that is rated for 30 Amps. Failure to use cable of large enough gauge may result in over temperature conditions, fire or personal injury and damage due to improper cable size. This condition is not covered under warranty.
The AC output plug (Hubbell inline socket) is connected to the back side of the PowerPack 3 as the end of a 4 foot pigtail. Refer to PowerPack 3 Wiring Diagram.

To connect to the AC output plug, you will need a Hubbell Watertight Safety-Shroud mail plug (Hubbell part No. HBL2611SW) to mate to the supplied Hubbell Watertight Safety-Shroud female socket (Hubbell part No. HBL2613SW). Using this part combination will allow for a weather resistant connection to the unit. Alteration of the AC output plug, failure to use the correct mail plug, or removal of the supplied socket will not guarantee a watertight connection and will void the warranty.

The power distribution circuits must be designed to prevent AC power feeding back from an external source (shore power or a generator) into the PowerPack 3 AC output. Failure to appropriately safeguard this connection is not covered under warranty.

The AC output from the PowerPack 3 is wired to a Ground Fault Circuit Interrupter (GFCI) to ensure protection against ground fault conditions. Be aware that standard duplex GFCI and non-GFCI receptacles need to be protected with a circuit breaker, usually rated for 15 or 20 Amps.

The ground terminal in the AC output wiring compartment must be tied to chassis ground for safety to prevent possible shock hazards. Damage due to improper grounding will void the warranty. Make sure a #8 AWG or larger wire is connected.

caution.para: Reverse feeding AC voltage into the Power Pack 3 will cause damage to the unit.

warning.para: Failure to have a connection from the PowerPack 3 to the vehicle's grounding system may result in a LETHAL shock hazard.

item.para: Locate and install properly rated GFCI and circuit breaker.
Connect the wiring - Hubbell part No. HBL2611SW plug to the circuit breaker and GFCI. Ensure that all wiring is properly sized and protected from moving parts, sharp edges, etc.
Connect the bonding lug to ground. Use a #10 AWG or larger copper conductor to connect the ground terminal to the chassis of the vehicle, the installation's grounding system, or to the earth ground.
Verify the installation. Verify all connections are tight and secure for maximum performance.

step1.para: Set the park brake and start the engine.
Turn on the PowerPack 3 from dash mounted switch.
Verify that 120 VAC is present at the output GFCI.
Refer to the Owner's Manual provided with this feature for troubleshooting procedures.
